name: The Pentagon
description: The headquarters of the United States Department of Defense. A massive pentagonal fortress of bureaucracy and war planning.
insights: SIGINT Capture: A localized signal jammer was active in the inner courtyard for 4 seconds. Someone was trying to block a specific briefcase from being scanned.

name: Silicon Valley Zenith Campus
description: The sprawling headquarters of a search engine giant, masking a subterranean AI research facility.
insights: Dark Web Chatter: A whistleblower claims the cooling systems are drawing 40% more power than publicly reported, suggesting a massive unlisted supercomputer is online.

name: Svalbard Global Seed Vault
description: A secure backup facility for the world's crop diversity on the Norwegian island of Spitsbergen. Remote and frozen.
insights: Surveillance Log: A private jet registered to a bio-tech firm landed off-schedule. They weren't depositing seeds; they were retrieving a canister labelled 'Sample 99'.

name: Canary Wharf Financial Hub
description: A dense cluster of banking skyscrapers in London where global capital flows intersect with high-frequency trading algorithms.
insights: Interpol Notice: Tracing a specific crypto-wallet led us here. Someone in the Sterling Tower is washing funds for the Lazarus Group.

name: GCHQ 'The Doughnut'
description: The UK's Government Communications Headquarters in Cheltenham. A ring-shaped building designed to monitor the world's digital whispers.
insights: Leak: A contractor left a USB drive at a local pub. It contains frequency maps for a new underwater cable tap in the Atlantic.

name: Huaqiangbei Electronics Market
description: Shenzhen's massive hardware bazaar. If a piece of tech exists, it can be cloned, modified, or hacked here.
insights: Local Contact: A vendor in Stall 4B is selling USB-C cables with embedded keyloggers. They claim the supply comes from a factory in Dongguan.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: The iron symbol of Paris. Packed with tourists, making it the perfect location for a dead drop in plain sight.
insights: Field Report: Our target taped a microSD card to the underside of the rivet on the North Pillar, 2nd floor. It was picked up by a street artist 10 minutes later.

name: Ashburn Data Alley
description: A nondescript region in Northern Virginia through which 70% of the world's internet traffic flows daily.
insights: SIGINT Intercept: Fiber tap installed on the main trunk line near Building 7. Someone is mirroring traffic from the Department of Energy.

name: Akihabara Electric Town
description: Tokyo's neon-soaked district for otaku culture and rare retro-computing hardware.
insights: Yakuza Rumor: The arcade on the corner is a front. The pachinko machines are mining Bitcoin using stolen electricity.

name: McMurdo Station
description: The largest research station in Antarctica. Isolated, harsh, and legally ambiguous.
insights: Satellite Uplink: A bandwidth spike was detected from the ice shelf. Someone is broadcasting encrypted telemetry data directly to a Chinese satellite.

name: Verne Global Data Center
description: A high-security data haven in Iceland powered by geothermal energy, used by organizations requiring total discretion.
insights: Log Analysis: A dormant account named 'IcePick' just accessed the biometric database. The IP address resolves to a satellite phone in the Atlantic.

name: Times Square
description: The brightly lit commercial intersection in Midtown Manhattan. A sensory overload that hides subtle digital signals.
insights: Visual Decode: The glitch on the massive cola billboard wasn't an error. It was Morse code blinking the coordinates for a safe house in Queens.

name: Unit 8200 Cyber Complex
description: Located near Tel Aviv, this area houses some of the world's most advanced cybersecurity startups and intelligence operatives.
insights: Leaked Memo: A new zero-day exploit targeting water treatment plants was just sold on the black market. Source traces back to a disgruntled ex-contractor here.

name: Cayman National Offshore
description: George Town's banking district, where thousands of shell companies share a single mailbox.
insights: Financial Audit: 'Poseidon LLC' just received a transfer of $50M. The company directors are listed as two deceased individuals from 1995.

name: CERN
description: The birthplace of the World Wide Web on the Franco-Swiss border, processing petabytes of particle collision data.
insights: System Alert: Anomaly detected in the Grid. Someone is hiding encrypted payloads inside the raw Boson data packages.

name: Machu Picchu
description: Ancient Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains. Difficult to access and perfect for clandestine meetings away from digital eyes.
insights: Drone Recon: Thermal imaging shows two heat signatures in the Temple of the Sun at midnight. They weren't tourists.

name: Hsinchu Science Park
description: Taiwan's 'Silicon Valley,' home to the world's most critical semiconductor foundries.
insights: Corporate Espionage: Blueprints for the 2nm chip architecture were briefly accessible on a public server. Suspect internal sabotage to lower stock prices.

name: The Pirate Bay Server Site
description: Hidden somewhere in the bedrock of Stockholm, a legacy node of digital resistance.
insights: IRC Chat Logs: Admin 'Anakata_Ghost' is looking for legacy PDP-11 hardware. They might be trying to revive an old Soviet dead-hand system.

name: Yandex Headquarters
description: The tech giant of Moscow, operating search, ride-hailing, and extensive user data aggregation.
insights: FSB Leak: A backdoor was hardcoded into the latest map update. It tracks user movement even when the phone is off.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: Australia's multi-venue performing arts centre. Its complex geometry makes for excellent acoustic masking.
insights: Audio Analysis: A directional mic picked up a conversation on the western boardwalk. Two diplomats were discussing a coup in the Pacific, hidden by the wind noise.

name: Large Millimeter Telescope
description: The world's largest single-dish steerable millimeter-wavelength telescope, sitting atop an extinct volcano in Mexico.
insights: Deep Space Scan: The telescope was briefly repurposed to listen to a frequency band used by military communication satellites, not stars.

name: Electronic City
description: Bangalore's massive IT industrial park, handling outsourced backend support for the Fortune 500.
insights: Social Engineering: A call center here is running a 'Tech Support' scam, but it's actually a cover for injecting ransomware into US hospital networks.

name: Pine Gap Signals Station
description: A joint defense facility in central Australia, a vacuum cleaner for satellite signals across the Eastern Hemisphere.
insights: Drone Feed: Heat signatures indicate three new server clusters were buried underground last week. They aren't on the official blueprints.

name: Lagos Computer Village
description: The largest ICT accessory market in Africa. A chaotic hive of repair shops, software pirates, and brilliant coders.
insights: Market Gossip: A group of teenagers here cracked the encryption on the new Central Bank digital currency. They are asking for a bounty, not a ransom.

name: Gangnam Crypto Hub
description: Seoul's upscale district, now teeming with blockchain startups and underground e-sports gambling rings.
insights: Transaction Alert: 4000 BTC moved from a dormant wallet to a local exchange. The wallet owner has been in prison for three years.

name: Moscow Kremlin
description: A fortified complex in the center of Moscow. The heart of political power and old-school espionage.
insights: Signal Triangulation: A high-frequency burst transmission originated from the Armory building. It was directed at a sleeper cell in Berlin.

name: Faria Lima Financial Center
description: SÃ£o Paulo's Wall Street. A fortress of glass where banking trojans are fought daily.
insights: Malware Analysis: The 'Boleto' banking virus has mutated. It's no longer stealing money; it's rewriting debt records to zero.

name: Dubai Internet City
description: A dedicated free trade zone for tech companies in the UAE, heavily monitored by state-of-the-art surveillance.
insights: Facial Rec Logs: The cameras tracked a known operative from 'The Syndicate' entering the Oracle building. He was wearing a prosthetic face.

name: NSA Utah Data Center
description: A massive facility in Bluffdale, Utah, designed to store yottabytes of global surveillance data.
insights: Power Grid Report: A massive surge was detected at 0400 hours. They just booted up 'The Prism.'
